sub_title: Finance Manager, Global Business Services (GBS) at Warner Bros Discovery (WBD)
summary:
I am a qualified Chartered Accountant specialising in Financial Accounting and Analysis with extensive experience in the commercial industry - Music, Media and Entertainment. I have worked for Australian and US listed companies, resulting in an understanding of the various reporting requirements.

With over 10 years technical accounting and financial reporting experience, I am highly skilled at interpreting financial and non-financial information, identifying key business drivers, producing full month-end reporting packs and building effective business relationships at all levels of the organisation. My solutions based attitude and approach have seen me implement processes and improvements which have driven efficiency and value within the organisation.

school.name: Chartered Accountants Australia and New Zealand

profile_positions.description:
International Television Production (ITVP), Global Business Services

A technically focussed Record to Report Finance Manager within Global Business Services. Ensuring the integrity and compliance of the departments Financial Reporting responsibilities (SOX, GAAP).

Collaborating with various territories to provide accounting expertise and guidance, leading internal projects and managing an accounting team offshore to ensure smooth and compliant financial operations within the television production division.
profile_positions.title: Finance Manager

company.name: Warner Bros. Entertainment Group of Companies

profile_positions.description:
I was the financial lead for various WB projects and initiatives. This included:

• Financial Modeling for new Sales Terms for one of the companies biggest customers to ensure maximum return
• Creating a new interactive forecasting model to assist the Sales Team in product demand planning
• Creating a consistent Commercial Finance presentation pack to use for quarterly submissions to the board
• Ownership of the Digital Reporting submission every quarter
profile_positions.title: Senior Commercial Analyst

profile_positions.description:
April 2017 - October 2017
Senior Financial Analyst for Disney Consumer Products - Licensing (Fashion and Home, UK & Ireland)

Responsible for providing financial and commercial support to the UK Softlines team (Fashion and Home). This role is focused on business partnering with Sales and other key stakeholders i.e. Consumer Insights team, Franchise teams and external licensees. I was in charge of communicating and managing the financial objectives, targets and budgets by working directly with the Sales Director, Sales Managers and Finance Director.

In addition to quarterly reporting objectives, this role required an inquisitive mind to question existing practices and implement efficiencies and process improvements.

Duties & responsibilities:
• Quarterly forecasts and close
• Financial Lead for UK Softlines Annual Operating Plan (AOP)
• Provide financial support to Sales teams
• Create financial presentation decks 
• Business partner with sales teams and licensees
• Monitor EPOS sell through and track performance
• Prepare submissions to Disney Regional
• Monitor franchise performance across key product categories
• Finance representative for Mickey franchise team
• Create new forecast and system upload templates


May 2016 - April 2017
Senior Financial Analyst for Disney Media Distribution (DMD) EMEA Regional.

Responsible for communicating key EMEA performance results to Head of Finance by consolidating and understanding financial drivers for all territories across EMEA. This includes building presentation decks that paint the financial picture for EMEA and providing explanations for key variances. 

Duties & responsibilities:
• EMEA quarterly forecast and close
• Prepare and present Financial decks to Head of Finance
• Prepare submissions to Burbank and Central Planning
• Key contact for any queries from the territories
• Manage and maintain financial system integrity
• Manage Media Ultimates and reporting
profile_positions.title: Senior Financial Analyst

company.name: Warner Bros. Entertainment Group of Companies

profile_positions.description:
Financial Analyst within the Home Entertainment group of Warner Bros Australia. 

Duties & responsibilities:
•	Validated all rebates, pricing and markdown claims
•	Calculated rebate entitlements for all customers
•	Streamlined the claims and rebates validation process
•	Ensured marketing deals (MDF, Co-op, Space etc) were within budget
•	Analysed key customer spends against target
•	Calculated monthly provisions based on customer promotions
•	Product sell-through tracking and customer profitability
•	Worked with Sales to recommend optimal trade terms
•	Business support through financial modeling and analysis
•	Business partnering with various department heads (Sales, Marketing, Corporate etc)
•	Month end close (accruals, journal posting, balance sheet reconciliation)
•	Inventory stock reporting and reconciliation
•	Variance analysis and commentary

Projects: Implemented processes to accurately account for client activity when they transitioned to a new ‘Consignment’ model. 

Systems and programs used:
- SAP
- SAP Business Objects
- Siebel
profile_positions.title: Financial Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for maintaining the accuracy and integrity of the financial ledgers for Ministry of Sound 
Australia and all of its sub entities (Vicious Recordings, Central Station Records, Joker Theory) and ensuring that reporting is compliant with Australian Accounting Standards. 

•	Prepared full monthly management accounts (B/S, P/L)
•	Accruals, balance sheet reconciliations and intercompany transactions
•	Weekly cash flow reporting, analysis and cash management
•	Managed the AP and AR function
•	Debtors management and recovery implementation
•	Reviewed all journal entries entered by the team
•	Calculated artist earnings and created their earning statements monthly
•	Monthly analysis of digital income and expenditure
•	Profitability analysis of local and international tours
•	Full royalty accounting (from advances to artist distribution)
•	Tax management – BAS lodgements, withholding tax applications
•	Maintained the Fixed Asset Register
•	Identified operational inefficiencies and implemented improvements
•	Supervised and trained two Assistant Accountants

Projects: Initiated and implemented a company wide debt recovery program for outstanding and overdue debts. This included a detailed plan of action on how to efficiently identify and recover bad debts. I successfully implemented a process to ensure that future debts are at an appropriate and manageable level. Over $1 million was recovered within the first 6 months.

Systems and programs used:
- Microsoft Dynamics GP
- FRX Reporting
profile_positions.title: Financial Accountant

profile_positions.description:
Support all department managers within the business unit by providing timely and accurate financial insights through standard and ad hoc reporting.

•	Variance analysis and month end reporting against actuals and forecasts
•	Budgeting and forecasting for the division
•       Month end accruals
•	FMA compliance reporting
•	Fringe benefits tax reporting and management
•	Asset management (vehicle leases)
•	Journal corrections to ensure account integrity
•	Corporate credit card management (ensuring timely payments and acquittals)
•	Preparation of accounts for year end financial statements 
•	Manipulation of financial data for ad hoc requests
•	Processing and organising payments for claims made against the Commonwealth
•	Divisional stakeholder relationship management
•	Staffing management - creation of job position numbers, altering job number attributes and shift work calculations
•       Month end cash reconciliations.

Projects: Involved in the national implementation of a new budget management system where I was responsible for UAT and training of staff across the whole country. 

Systems and programs used:
- Cognos Cube
- SAP
- QSP
- ReportNet
- PeopleSoft
profile_positions.title: Senior Finance Officer

profile_positions.description:
Summer Internship Program with full audit training.

Worked within Auditing and Assurance Services - Retail, Consumer and Industrial Products. 

•	Controls testing, analytical reviews and general audit field work
•	Account reconciliation and financial data manipulation
•	Review and check client statements
•	Assist in Year End Audits and Half Year Reviews
•	Support the Senior Accountant and Manager
profile_positions.title: Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: Providing first aid services to the community at a number of large scale events, managing a team of volunteers and training new members joining the division.
